name: FailureToPayInterest
definition: default event that where either an expected interest payment is missed altogether or the amount paid is less than the required amount
label: failure to pay interest

name: FailureToPay
label: failure to pay
definition: default event that is triggered following any applicable grace period in which a payment obligation is missed

name: DefaultEvent
definition: credit event representing a failure to meet a contractual obligation, such as failure to repay a debt including interest or principal on a loan or security
label: default event
explanatoryNote: A default can occur when a borrower is unable to make timely payments, misses payments, or avoids or stops making payments, typically with respect to a single transaction. A default has adverse effects on the borrower's credit and ability to borrow in the future, and allows the creditor to demand immediate repayment of the obligation in full.

name: FailureToPayPrincipal
label: failure to pay principal
definition: default event that where either an expected principal payment is missed altogether or the amount paid is less than the required amount

name: ObligationSpecificCreditEvent
definition: credit event that relates to an individual credit agreement or debt instrument (reference obligation)
label: obligation-specific credit event

name: CreditEvent
definition: event signifying a sudden change in credit standing, such as bankruptcy or a violation of a bond indenture or loan agreement, that raises doubts about the party's ability to meet current or future obligations
label: credit event

name: SoftCreditEvent
definition: default event that is repairable
explanatoryNote: If the default is not repaired within a grace period, then a failure to repair (failure to pay) credit event is triggered, potentially as a hard default.
label: soft credit event

name: Downgrade
definition: credit event triggered when the credit rating of a party or obligation is lowered
label: downgrade

name: EntitySpecificCreditEvent
definition: credit event that applies to a given legal person
label: entity-specific credit event

name: Moratorium
label: moratorium
explanatoryNote: A moratorium may be a legally-mandated hiatus in debt collection as a part of a bankruptcy process.
definition: entity-specific credit event involving a temporary suspension of payments until related issues are resolved

name: Bankruptcy
label: bankruptcy
definition: credit event involving a change in state or condition in which a party becomes insolvent

name: Repudiation
definition: credit event involving the refusal to honor the terms of a contract
label: repudiation

name: ObligationAcceleration
label: obligation acceleration
definition: credit event triggered when one or more reference obligations become immediately due and payable as a result of a default or covenant breach on the reference entity's other debt instruments, subject to a materiality threshold

name: InstallmentDefault
label: installment default
explanatoryNote: The latter may result in a court action by the issuer or the sale of the securities to recover costs and/or a forfeit of partially paid securities.
definition: default event involving non-payment of several installment payments as scheduled in the terms of the agreement, or non-payment of a call by the beneficial owner

name: MaturityExtension
definition: credit event involving extension of payments beyond the original maturity date of the obligation
explanatoryNote: As stipulated in the terms and conditions for a bond, for example, the issuer or the bondholder may prolong the maturity date. After extension, the security may differ from original issue (new rate or maturity date). May be subject to bondholder's approval.
label: maturity extension

name: ObligationRestructuring
definition: credit event that materially impacts an obligation, such as an interest rate reduction, principal reduction, deferral of interest or principal, change in priority ranking, or change in currency or composition of payment
label: obligation restructuring

name: DistressedRatingsDowngrade
label: distressed ratings downgrade
definition: credit event triggered when the credit rating of an obligation is downgraded to a distressed debt level

name: ObligationDefault
label: obligation default
definition: credit event triggered as a result of an obligation-specific default

name: WriteDown
definition: obligation-specific credit event whereby the book value of the obligation, such as the outstanding principal amount, is reduced
label: write-down

name: HardCreditEvent
definition: default event that is not repairable
label: hard credit event

name: FilingForBankruptcy
explanatoryNote: The bankruptcy process is initiated via a petition filed by the debtor or on behalf of creditors. The debtor's assets may be used to repay a portion of outstanding debt as specified by the court or a court-appointed individual.
definition: credit event that involves a request to a court to be recognized as bankrupt
label: filing for bankruptcy

name: isGracePeriodExtendable
definition: indicates whether or not the grace period may be extended, which may be jurisdiction specific
label: is grace period extendable

name: hasGracePeriod
definition: window following any payment due date during which a party must fulfill its obligations before a failure to pay credit event occurs
explanatoryNote: Note that this may be a period denominated in business days or calendar days.
label: has grace period

name: involvesMultipleEvents
label: involves multiple events
definition: indicates that the restructuring spans more than one credit event

name: hasDefaultThresholdAmount
definition: specifies an amount of money that triggers a failure to pay, repudiation/moratorium or restructuring event
label: has default threshold amount
